intro: Halimium umbellatum, commonly known as the rock rose, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features woody stems and small, leathery leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its most striking feature is its clusters of bright yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Halimium umbellatum thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in coastal and Mediterranean climates.
